page.title: 05Arable Farming Gunton Area
page.content: The land in this area is grade 1-2. Agricultural Land i.e.very fertile intensivly farmed soil suitable for arable crops.In order to accomadate the large modern machinery many of the smaller fields have been amalgamated which has resulted in the loss of some hedgerows.Smaller enclosed paddocks of grassland are found in close proximity to several of the cottages.Much of the land is farmed by owner-occupiers.The major crops grown are barley,wheat,sugar beet and potatoes.On a smaller scale, oil seed rape, certain soft fruits (straw- berries, blackcurrets),cabbages plus peas and beans for freezing purposes are grown. The relative quantities of these crops varies from year to year as the system of crop rotation is implemented.
